caption: Applied Portfolio Management PART VII
cells:
Wealthy individuals or families who provide funding at the very earliest stages of start-ups in
exchange for equity or convertible debt positions.

Professionally managed money that provides funding for start-ups in exchange for equity. They are
organized as independent venture funds or corporate venture capital to invest in all stages of start-
up development: seed capital, early stage, and late stage. Venture capital can specialize in one
industry or invest across industries.

Investment firms that use an equity position levered by a large debt position to purchase mature,
often publicly traded companies with the intent of improving their operations, governance, and
financial positions. A management buyout is a one-off transaction similar to a leveraged buyout
but conducted by the management team of the acquired company.
Minority equity investments in companies that need capital to expand operations.

Subordinated debt (often convertible) or preferred stock investments, which are used to support
growth of start-ups and other private equity investments.
